business.headline: CEO quits, HR head stays: Why Astronomer didn't fire Kristin Cabot over kiss cam rowAstronomer CEO Andy Byron resigned after a viral kiss cam video showed him and HR head Kristin Cabot cuddling at a Coldplay concert, sparking public backlash. While Cabot remains employed, legal experts say contractual obligations and internal investigations likely explain the delay in any action against her.

Paytm posts Rs 123 crore profit in Q1FY26, strengthens lead in merchant paymentsOperating revenue rises 28% YoY; contribution profit up 52% as AI-led efficiencies and financial services boost bottom line.

Who Is Anish Shah, the auto CEO whose salary nearly doubled to Rs 47 crore?Anish Shah, Group CEO and managing director of the Mahindra Group, entered the list of top 5 paid auto CEOs for the first time. He received a 95% hike in pay, with his total earnings touching Rs 47.33 crore in FY25.

How a small AIS check can save you from a tax noticeIf you skip checking your AIS, you might end up missing some income details. This can lead to a mismatch between what you file and what the tax department already knows, and that can easily get you a notice later.
Sensex closes flat, Nifty below 25,100; Eternal up 11%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 13.53 points to end at 82,186.81, while the NSE Nifty50 ended lower by 29.80 points to close at 25,060.90.

Why Tesla's ride into India's EV market won't be a smooth oneTesla's entry comes at a time when it is facing its biggest drop in global sales to date. Its domestic sales in the US fell 6.3% in the second quarter of 2025, the third straight quarterly decline.
NOIDA is now tax-free. Check who benefits and howAt a time when cities are competing hard to attract businesses and investors, this tax relief could give NOIDA a fresh edge.

Government receives plea to cut 28% GST on aerated drinksThe matter is likely to be taken up at the upcoming 56th GST Council meeting, expected to be held in mid-August. The meeting is already set to review a broader rate rationalisation framework, with officials indicating that certain slabs and cesses may be simplified or merged.

Chanda Kochhar found guilty in Rs 64-crore Videocon bribe case: ReportAn appellate tribunal gave this ruling in an order dated July 3. The tribunal said that the money was routed through Kochhar's husband Deepak Kochhar, using a company connected to Videocon.

Are Indian homebuyers growing wealth or buying liabilities? Explains consultantA real-estate consultant points out that the middle class often assumes owning a house means they are moving forward, but in reality, possession alone does not guarantee real financial progress.

SBI to approach CBI after tagging Anil Ambani and RCom as 'fraud'SBI's exposure to Reliance Communications includes a fund-based principal outstanding of Rs 2,227.64 crore, along with interest and expenses since August 26, 2016. In addition, there is a non-fund based bank guarantee exposure of Rs 786.52 crore.

RBI proposes stricter digital banking rules: What it means for youTo keep online fraud in check, all banks must use proper fraud detection tools and keep an eye on unusual transactions. They should also study how customers usually spend money so that any odd activity can be spotted quickly.

entertainment.headline: Amar Upadhyay on being offered Mihir in Kyunki...: Thought someone had pulled a prankActor Amar Upadhyay is all set to reprise his role of Mihir Virani in Ekta Kapoor 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'. In a new promo, he shared his reaction to being offered the iconic character.

Black Sabbath lead singer Ozzy Osbourne dies at 76, weeks after farewell showThe British rocker rose to fame as the lead singer of Black Sabbath, where his voice became a defining force of heavy metal. He introduced the world to groundbreaking tracks like "Iron Man," "Paranoid," and "War Pigs."

Vidya Balan backs flexible working hours for new mothers amid Deepika-Vanga rowActor Vidya Balan recently spoke about the need for flexible working hours to support new mothers in the film industry. She urged the adoption of empathetic work cultures to retain women workforce in cinema.

Karuppu: Suriya's stylish first look unveiled ahead of teaser launch on birthdayActor Suriya's first look from director RJ Balaji's 'Karuppu' was unveiled ahead of the film's teaser launch. The teaser releases on July 23, which also marks the actor's 50th birthday.

Malvika Raaj flaunts baby bump in pics from Mary Poppins-themed baby showerMalvika Raaj, who played young Poo in 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham', recently shared dreamy pictures from her Mary Poppins-themed baby shower with husband Pranav Bagga. The couple, who got married in 2023, are now expecting their first child.

Meet Mahesh from Saiyaara, the low-key villain in Krish and Vaani's love storyActor Shaan R Grover got his big break with 'Saiyaara', where he played a strong role as the ex-boyfriend with a negative side. After years of struggle, training, and auditions, this hit film became a turning point in his career.

Rakesh Roshan shares update after angioplasty, urges brain and heart checks post 45Director Rakesh Roshan recently underwent angioplasty after discovering a serious carotid artery blockage. He now urged people above 45 to prioritise preventive heart and brain health checks.

Anne Hathaway shares the most teasing tease of The Devil Wears Prada 2Anne Hathaway teased her return as Andy Sachs in 'The Devil Wears Prada 2' with a stylish video and photo, exciting fans about the upcoming sequel. Disney has confirmed the film is in development, with original stars and new cast members set to join.

Avatar: Fire and Ash trailer to premiere in theatres before Fantastic FourThe trailer for 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' will be shown exclusively with 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps'. It will offer a glimpse into the new Na'vi tribes and their conflicts.
Lady Gaga tumbles mid-performance during Mayhem Ball Tour in Las VegasThe iconic singer fell awkwardly after her cameraman nearly lost his balance. Watch the video.

Salman Khan restores vintage Triumph bike bought by father Salim Khan in 1956Salman Khan shares a heartfelt story about restoring his father's first bike, a Triumph Tiger 100, from a Hyderabad junkyard.

Dulquer Salmaan to distribute Raj B Shetty's Su From So in MalayalamMalayalam actor Dulquer Salman will be distributing the Malayalam dubbed version of Kannada film 'Su From So' under his banner, Wayfarer Films. 'Su From So' has been produced under Kannada actor Raj B Shetty's Lighter Buddha Films.

Aamir Khan breaks silence on rumours of making a film on Meghalaya murder caseAamir Khan clarifies he is not working on a film about a recent murder case in Meghalaya, dismissing circulating rumours. The actor addressed speculation in an interview, stating such reports are unfounded.

Son of Sardaar 2 duja trailer: Ajay Devgn caught between love, mafia and mayhemA new trailer for actor Ajay Devgn's 'Son of Sardaar 2' was released on Wednesday. It offers a deeper look into the comedic chaos surrounding Jassi's life. The film also stars Neeru Bajwa, Mrunal Thakur, Deepak Dobriyal and Ravi Kishan in key roles.

I would love to surrender in love: Fatima Sana Shaikh l ExclusiveActor Fatima Sana Shaikh recently opened up on what love means to her in today's world. In an interaction with India Today, she also highlighted the challenges of dating apps and the craving for genuine connection in modern times.

Did you know Ahaan Panday's father Chikki once bailed SRK out of prison?Ahaan Panday's father, Chikki Panday, has shared a close friendship with Shah Rukh Khan. They've known each other for more than thirty years.
Why Gen Z is freaking out over The Love Hypothesis movie castingFrom fanfiction roots to casting headlines, 'The Love Hypothesis' movie is making waves. Here's everything you need to know.

Actor Cho Yi-hyun can't get over Choo Young-woo's shirtless charm in BTS. WatchKorean actor Cho Yi Hyun posts a fun behind-the-scenes clip featuring her shirtless co-star Choo Young Woo. The video has fans melting over their undeniable chemistry in Head Over Heels.

Sanjay Dutt wishes wife Maanayata on 47th birthday: My strength, my supportSanjay Dutt shared a heartfelt birthday message to his wife Maanayata on her 47th birthday, calling her his strength and support. Their children, along with Trishala Dutt, also posted loving wishes, making it a special family celebration.

general news.headline: Dhankhar exit: What happened between 1 pm and 4.30 pm broke the camel's backVice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar surprised one and all by resigning late Monday evening, citing health as the reason. Opposition leaders and developments of the day suggest there's more to the story than what meets the eye. What happened between 1 pm and 4.30 pm that turned a normal day into an extraordinary evening?

Framed, stripped, left bloodied: Indian man attacked by 'racist gang' in IrelandAn Indian man in his 40s was assaulted and stripped by a group of youngsters in Dublin after he was falsely accused of behaving inappropriately around children. Police were treating the incident as an apparent hate crime.

Shoot me but nothing more: Pak woman's dishonour-killing clip leads to arrestsA viral video of a Pakistani woman, along with a man, and her final words before being executed by tribal men, including her brother, sparked widespread outrage. A month after the incident and much hue and cry, Balochistan police have arrested 13 people, including the tribal chief who ordered the killings.

Jagdeep Dhankhar overstepped his limit, lost government's confidence: ChidambaramSenior Congress leader P Chidambaram said it was clear that Jagdeep Dhankhar and the Modi government were no longer on the same page.

Caught on CCTV: Receptionist kicked, dragged by hair for telling patient to waitMan tries to enter the doctor's cabin, when stopped by receptionist, he kicks her and drags her by the hair across the reception area.

Why is Saiyaara winning hearts (and the box office)?In a world constantly chasing virality, 'Saiyaara' chooses vulnerability. It doesn't offer a spectacle - it offers sincerity. And if you are still wondering why it's working, here's what you probably don't know.

Mamata Banerjee's fitness certificate for bete noire Dhankhar after shock exitWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said Jagdeep Dhankhar, who quit as Vice President due to health issues, is a healthy man and doing absolutely fine. Banerjee's remarks came amid rumours surrounding Dhankhar's shock resignation.

Odisha girl dragged into forest, raped; escapes, assaulted again by truck driverA girl in Odisha was gang-raped by three men in a forest after being abducted, then sexually assaulted by a truck driver moments after escaping.

Air India Hong Kong-Delhi flight catches fire as passengers get off, all safeAn Air India flight coming from Hong Kong caught fire as passengers were disembarking at Delhi airport. The aircraft suffered some damage and was grounded, but all passengers were safe.

Over 52 lakh names removed from Bihar voter list in ongoing revision: Poll bodyThe Election Commission said the names removed include 18 lakh voters reported dead, 26 lakh who have moved to other constituencies and 7 lakh who are registered in more than one place.

Why don't you earn? Supreme Court raps woman for Rs 12 crore, flat, BMW alimonyDuring the hearing, CJI Gavai questioned the scale of her demand, stating, "Your marriage lasted only 18 months, and now you want a BMW too? One crore every month?"

Your careers will end: Indian shuttlers threatened at World University GamesAfter Indian badminton players exposed the gross mismanagement in the World University Games, they have been threatened that their careers will be ruined once they return to the country.

How Martyrs' Day marked Mamata's rallying cry to defeat BJP in Bengal and beyondNephew Abhishek Banerjee vowed to put the BJP "in a detention camp democratically in 2026" as the Trinamool Congress raised the pitch on Bengali identity

The Castro grandson who Fidels as Havana plunges into darknessSandro Castro, grandson of Fidel Castro, lives in opulence while Cuba reels under economic collapse, blackouts, and shortages. He flaunts designer clothes, luxury cars, and yacht parties on Instagram, symbols of inherited privilege in a nation where most earn just $16.5 a month. As Havana burns, he lives a life of luxury.

Employees welcome client to office with dance performance. Video sparks outrageA now-viral video showing employees welcoming a foreign client with a dance performance at their office has sparked outrage online.

No tax relief for Congress, tribunal says no exemption on Rs 199 crore donationsThe IT tribunal upheld the decision of the tax authorities, ruling that the party must pay income tax on the donations received during that financial year.

Karun Nair deserves one last chance, says Aakash Chopra ahead of Manchester TestFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra feels that Karun Nair should be given one more chance ahead of the Manchester Test between England and India, which will begin on July 23.

BAN vs PAK: Bangladesh dedicate historic series win to jet tragedy victimsBangladesh secured a historic T20I series win against Pakistan with an eight-run victory. The team emotionally dedicated their triumph to the victims of the recent jet tragedy in Dhaka.

After getting fined of over-rate, Ben Stokes blasts ICCEngland captain Ben Stokes has criticised the ICC for slow over-rate fines after the Lord's Test. He urges the international body to adopt flexible rules considering different playing conditions.

SA vs NZ: Seifert, bowlers help New Zealand remain unbeaten in tri-seriesTim Seifert's unbeaten 66 powered New Zealand to a seven-wicket win over South Africa in Harare. The victory keeps New Zealand unbeaten in the tri-series and sets up a strong final showdown.

4th Test, India predicted XI: Kamboj to debut, still no place for Kuldeep?India face a tough challenge as injuries disrupt their lineup ahead of the Manchester Test. With the series on the line, will India put their faith in young Anshul Kamboj, and will Kuldeep Yadav finally get his chance to play in England?

Father vs Son: Hassan Eisakhil hits Mohammad Nabi for six in Afghan LeagueIn a rare father vs son moment in the Shpageeza Cricket League in Afghanistan, Hassan Eisakhli took on Mohammad Nabi and hit for a towering six during a league match on Tuesday, July 22.

Gill had a heated run-in with England openers Zak Crawley and Ben Duckett.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
